page.title: 20Industry Gravel Extraction 2
page.content: At present there is some debate going on as to whether the Tarmac Company should be allowed to develop more pits within the area. Many local residents object to this, since they feel it would spoil the predominantly rural aspect of the village, and may adversly affect property values. The pits that have become exhausted have flooded and vegitation has been encouraged to grow around them. They now form an attractive area with a large recreational potential. A series of footpaths have been established forming a number of very pleasant walks around the pits and through the fast growing trees and shrubs planted as part of the naturalisation process. The pits themselves are used by anglers and water sportsmen as well as forming a haven for wildlife and birds.
